ayahs.englishText: Alif. Lam. Ra. THESE ARE MESSAGES of revelation -of a discourse clear in itself and clearly showing the truth.
ayahs.arabicText: الر ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ وَقُرْآنٍ مُبِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: And it will come to pass that those who are [now] bent on denying this truth will wish that they had surrendered themselves to God [in their life time].
ayahs.arabicText: رُبَمَا يَوَدُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْ كَانُوا مُسْلِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Leave them alone; let them eat and enjoy themselves the while the hope [of vain delights] be guiles them: for in time they will come to know [the truth].
ayahs.arabicText: ذَرْهُمْ يَأْكُلُوا وَيَتَمَتَّعُوا وَيُلْهِهِمُ الْأَمَلُ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And never have We destroyed any community [for its wrongdoing] unless a divine writ had (previously] been made known to it;
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا وَلَهَا كِتَابٌ مَعْلُومٌ

ayahs.englishText: [but remember that] no community can ever forestall [the end of] its term - and neither can they delay [it].
ayahs.arabicText: مَا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَأْخِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And yet, they [who deny the truth] say: "O thou unto whom this reminder has [allegedly] been bestowed from on high: verily, thou art mad!
ayahs.arabicText: وَقَالُوا يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِي نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ الذِّكْرُ إِنَّكَ لَمَجْنُونٌ

ayahs.englishText: Why dost thou not bring before us angels, if thou art a man of truth?
ayahs.arabicText: لَوْ مَا تَأْتِينَا بِالْمَلَائِكَةِ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [Yet] We never send down angels otherwise than in accordance with the [demands of] truth; and [were the angels to appear now,] lo! they [who reject this divine writ] would have no further respite!
ayahs.arabicText: مَا نُنَزِّلُ الْمَلَائِكَةَ إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَمَا كَانُوا إِذًا مُنْظَرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Behold, it is We Ourselves who have bestowed from on high, step by step, this reminder? and, behold, it is We who shall truly guard it [from all corruption].
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا الذِّكْرَ وَإِنَّا لَهُ لَحَافِظُونَ

ayahs.englishText: AND, INDEED, [O Prophet,] even before thy time did We send [Our apostles] unto communities of old -
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِنْ قَبْلِكَ فِي شِيَعِ الْأَوَّلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and never yet came an apostle to them without their deriding him.
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ رَسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Even so do We [now] cause this [scorn of Our message] to pervade the hearts of those who are lost in sin,
ayahs.arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ نَسْلُكُهُ فِي قُلُوبِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: who do not believe in it, although the way which those [evildoers] of olden times had to go has long been within their ken.
ayahs.arabicText: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ ۖ وَقَدْ خَلَتْ سُنَّةُ الْأَوَّلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Yet even had We opened to them a gateway to heaven and they had ascended, on and on, up to it,
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَوْ فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ بَابًا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ فَظَلُّوا فِيهِ يَعْرُجُونَ

ayahs.englishText: they would surely have said, "It is only our eyes that are spellbound! Nay, we have been bewitched!,
ayahs.arabicText: لَقَالُوا إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتْ أَبْصَارُنَا بَلْ نَحْنُ قَوْمٌ مَسْحُورُونَ

ayahs.englishText: AND, INDEED, We have set up in the heavens great constellations, and endowed them with beauty for all to behold;
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا فِي السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجًا وَزَيَّنَّاهَا لِلنَّاظِرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and We have made them secure against every satanic force accursed -
ayahs.arabicText: وَحَفِظْنَاهَا مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْطَانٍ رَجِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: so that anyone who seeks to learn [the unknowable] by stealth is pursued by a flame clear to see.
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَّا مَنِ اسْتَرَقَ السَّمْعَ فَأَتْبَعَهُ شِهَابٌ مُبِينٌ

ayahs.englishText: And the earth -We have spread it out wide, and placed on it mountains firm, and caused [life] of every kind to grow on it in a balanced manner,
ayahs.arabicText: وَالْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَاهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ مَوْزُونٍ

ayahs.englishText: and provided thereon means of livelihood for you [O men] as well as for all [living beings] whose sustenance does not depend on you.
ayahs.arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَعَايِشَ وَمَنْ لَسْتُمْ لَهُ بِرَازِقِينَ

ayahs.englishText: For, no single thing exists that does not have its source with Us; and nought do We bestow from on high unless it be in accordance with a measure well-defined.
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنْ مِنْ شَيْءٍ إِلَّا عِنْدَنَا خَزَائِنُهُ وَمَا نُنَزِّلُهُ إِلَّا بِقَدَرٍ مَعْلُومٍ

ayahs.englishText: And We let loose the winds to fertilize [plants] and We send down water from the skies and let you drink thereof: and it is not you who dispose of its source-
ayahs.arabicText: وَأَرْسَلْنَا الرِّيَاحَ لَوَاقِحَ فَأَنْزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَسْقَيْنَاكُمُوهُ وَمَا أَنْتُمْ لَهُ بِخَازِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: for, behold, it is We-We alone -who grant life and deal death, and it is We alone who shall remain after all else will have passed away!
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ نُحْيِي وَنُمِيتُ وَنَحْنُ الْوَارِثُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And well do We know [the hearts and deeds of all human beings - both] those who lived before you and those who will come after you;
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا الْمُسْتَقْدِمِينَ مِنْكُمْ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا الْمُسْتَأْخِرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and, behold, it is thy Sustainer who will gather them all together [on Judgment Day]: verily, He is wise, all-knowing!
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٌ

ayahs.englishText: AND, INDEED, We have created man out of sounding clay, out of dark-slime transmuted
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ صَلْصَالٍ مِنْ حَمَإٍ مَسْنُونٍ

ayahs.englishText: whereas the invisible beings We had created, [long] before that, out of the fire of scorching winds.
ayahs.arabicText: وَالْجَانَّ خَلَقْنَاهُ مِنْ قَبْلُ مِنْ نَارِ السَّمُومِ

ayahs.englishText: And lo! Thy Sustainer said unto the angels: "Behold, I am about to create mortal man out of sounding clay, out of dark slime transmuted;
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ إِنِّي خَالِقٌ بَشَرًا مِنْ صَلْصَالٍ مِنْ حَمَإٍ مَسْنُونٍ

ayahs.englishText: and when I have formed him fully and breathed into him of My spirit, fall down before him in prostration!
ayahs.arabicText: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِنْ رُوحِي فَقَعُوا لَهُ سَاجِدِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Thereupon the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together,
ayahs.arabicText: فَسَجَدَ الْمَلَائِكَةُ كُلُّهُمْ أَجْمَعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: save Iblis: he refused to be among those who prostrated themselves.
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ أَنْ يَكُونَ مَعَ السَّاجِدِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Said He: "O Iblis! What is thy reason for not being among those who have prostrated themselves?"
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ يَا إِبْلِيسُ مَا لَكَ أَلَّا تَكُونَ مَعَ السَّاجِدِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [Iblis] replied: "It is not for me to prostrate myself before mortal man whom Thou hast created out of sounding clay, out of dark slime transmuted!"
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ لَمْ أَكُنْ لِأَسْجُدَ لِبَشَرٍ خَلَقْتَهُ مِنْ صَلْصَالٍ مِنْ حَمَإٍ مَسْنُونٍ

ayahs.englishText: Said He: "Go forth, then, from this [angelic state]: for, behold, thou art [henceforth] accursed,
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ فَاخْرُجْ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٌ

ayahs.englishText: and [My] rejection shall be thy due until the Day of Judgment!"
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ اللَّعْنَةَ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ

ayahs.englishText: Said [Iblis]: "Then, O my Sustainer, grant me a respite till the Day when all shall be raised from the dead!"
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنْظِرْنِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Answered He: "Verily, so be it: thou shalt be among those who are granted respite
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ الْمُنْظَرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: till the Day the time whereof is known [to Me alone]."
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْوَقْتِ الْمَعْلُومِ

ayahs.englishText: [Whereupon Iblis] said: "O my Sustainer! Since Thou hast thwarted me, I shall indeed make [all that is evil] on earth seem goodly to them, and shall most certainly beguile them-into grievous error -
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَا أَغْوَيْتَنِي لَأُزَيِّنَنَّ لَهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [all] save such of them as are truly Thy servants!"
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنْهُمُ الْمُخْلَصِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Said He: "This is, with Me. a straight way:
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ هَٰذَا صِرَاطٌ عَلَيَّ مُسْتَقِيمٌ

ayahs.englishText: verily, thou shalt have no power over My creatures- unless it be such as are [already] lost in grievous error and follow thee [of their own will]:
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ عِبَادِي لَيْسَ لَكَ عَلَيْهِمْ سُلْطَانٌ إِلَّا مَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْغَاوِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and for all such, behold, hell is the promised goal.
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمَوْعِدُهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

ayahs.englishText: with seven gates leading into it, each gate receiving its allotted share of sinners. -
ayahs.arabicText: لَهَا سَبْعَةُ أَبْوَابٍ لِكُلِّ بَابٍ مِنْهُمْ جُزْءٌ مَقْسُومٌ

ayahs.englishText: VERILY, those who are conscious of God [shall find themselves in the hereafter] amidst gardens and springs,
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ

ayahs.englishText: [having been received with the greeting,] "Enter here in peace, secure!"
ayahs.arabicText: ادْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَامٍ آمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And [by then] We shall have removed whatever unworthy thoughts or feelings may have been [lingering] in their breasts, [and they shall rest] as brethren, facing one another [in love] upon thrones of happiness.
ayahs.arabicText: وَنَزَعْنَا مَا فِي صُدُورِهِمْ مِنْ غِلٍّ إِخْوَانًا عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مُتَقَابِلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: No weariness shall ever touch them in this [state of bliss], and never shall they have to forgo it.
ayahs.arabicText: لَا يَمَسُّهُمْ فِيهَا نَصَبٌ وَمَا هُمْ مِنْهَا بِمُخْرَجِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Tell My servants that I - I alone - am truly forgiving, a true dispenser of grace;
ayahs.arabicText: ۞ نَبِّئْ عِبَادِي أَنِّي أَنَا الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ

ayahs.englishText: and [also,] that the suffering which I shall impose [on sinners] will indeed be a suffering most grievous.
ayahs.arabicText: وَأَنَّ عَذَابِي هُوَ الْعَذَابُ الْأَلِيمُ

ayahs.englishText: AND TELL THEM [once again] about Abraham's guests -
ayahs.arabicText: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ عَنْ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ

ayahs.englishText: [how,] when they presented themselves before him and bade him peace, he answered: "Behold, we are afraid of you!"
ayahs.arabicText: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا قَالَ إِنَّا مِنْكُمْ وَجِلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Said they: "Fear not! Behold, we bring thee the glad tiding of [the birth of] a son who will be endowed with deep knowledge."
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا لَا تَوْجَلْ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: Said he: "Do you give me this glad tiding despite the fact that old age has overtaken me? Of what [strange thing], then, are you giving me a tiding!"
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ أَبَشَّرْتُمُونِي عَلَىٰ أَنْ مَسَّنِيَ الْكِبَرُ فَبِمَ تُبَشِّرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: They answered: "We have given thee the glad tiding of something that is bound to come true. - so be not of those who abandon hope!"
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا بَشَّرْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ فَلَا تَكُنْ مِنَ الْقَانِطِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [Abraham] exclaimed: "And who-other than those who have utterly lost their way-could ever abandon the hope of his Sustainer's grace?"
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ وَمَنْ يَقْنَطُ مِنْ رَحْمَةِ رَبِّهِ إِلَّا الضَّالُّونَ

ayahs.englishText: He added: "And what [else] may you have in view, O you [heavenly] messengers?"
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: They answered: "We are sent to people lost in sin [who are to be destroyed],
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُجْرِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: barring Lot's household, all of whom, behold, we shall save -
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ إِنَّا لَمُنَجُّوهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

ayahs.englishText: excepting only his wife, [of whom God says,] `We have ordained [that], behold, she should be among those who stay behind!'
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَّا امْرَأَتَهُ قَدَّرْنَا ۙ إِنَّهَا لَمِنَ الْغَابِرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: AND WHEN the messengers [of God] came to the house of Lot,
ayahs.arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ آلَ لُوطٍ الْمُرْسَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: he said: "Behold, you are people unknown [here]!"
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّكُمْ قَوْمٌ مُنْكَرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: They answered: "Nay, but we have come unto thee with [the announcement of] something that they [who are given to evil] have always been wont to call in question,
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا بَلْ جِئْنَاكَ بِمَا كَانُوا فِيهِ يَمْتَرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and we are bringing thee the certainty [of its fulfilment]: for, behold, we are speaking the truth indeed.
ayahs.arabicText: وَأَتَيْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ وَإِنَّا لَصَادِقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Go, then., with thy household while it is yet night, with thyself following them in the rear; and let none of you look back, but proceed whither you are bidden."
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَسْرِ بِأَهْلِكَ بِقِطْعٍ مِنَ اللَّيْلِ وَاتَّبِعْ أَدْبَارَهُمْ وَلَا يَلْتَفِتْ مِنْكُمْ أَحَدٌ وَامْضُوا حَيْثُ تُؤْمَرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And [through Our messengers] We revealed unto him this decree: "The last remnant of those [sinners] shall be wiped out" in the morn."
ayahs.arabicText: وَقَضَيْنَا إِلَيْهِ ذَٰلِكَ الْأَمْرَ أَنَّ دَابِرَ هَٰؤُلَاءِ مَقْطُوعٌ مُصْبِحِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And the people of the city came [unto Lot], rejoicing at the glad tiding.
ayahs.arabicText: وَجَاءَ أَهْلُ الْمَدِينَةِ يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Exclaimed [Lot]: "Behold, these are my guests: so put me not to shame,
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ ضَيْفِي فَلَا تَفْضَحُونِ

ayahs.englishText: but be conscious of God and disgrace me not!"
ayahs.arabicText: وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَلَا تُخْزُونِ

ayahs.englishText: They answered: "Have we not forbidden thee [to offer protection] to any kind of people?"
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا أَوَلَمْ نَنْهَكَ عَنِ الْعَالَمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [Lot] said: "[Take instead] these daughters of mine, if you must do [whatever you intend to do]!"
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ هَٰؤُلَاءِ بَنَاتِي إِنْ كُنْتُمْ فَاعِلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [But the angels spoke thus:] "As thou livest, [O Lot, they will not listen to thee:] behold, in their delirium [of lust] they are but blindly stumbling to and fro!"
ayahs.arabicText: لَعَمْرُكَ إِنَّهُمْ لَفِي سَكْرَتِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And thereupon the blast [of Our punishment] overtook them at the time of sunrise,
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّيْحَةُ مُشْرِقِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and We turned those [sinful towns} upside down, and rained down upon them stone-hard blows of chastisement pre-ordained.
ayahs.arabicText: فَجَعَلْنَا عَالِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِنْ سِجِّيلٍ

ayahs.englishText: Verily, in all this there are messages indeed for those who can read the signs:
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِلْمُتَوَسِّمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: for, behold, those [towns] stood by a road that still exists.
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّهَا لَبِسَبِيلٍ مُقِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: Verily, herein lies a message indeed for all who believe [in God].
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: AND THE DWELLERS of the wooded dales [of Madyan, too,] were inveterate evildoers,
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنْ كَانَ أَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ لَظَالِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and so We inflicted Our retribution on them. And, behold, both these [sinful communities] lived by a highway, [to this day] plain to see
ayahs.arabicText: فَانْتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ وَإِنَّهُمَا لَبِإِمَامٍ مُبِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: AND, [likewise,] indeed, the people of Al-Hijr gave the lie to [Our] message-bearers:
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ أَصْحَابُ الْحِجْرِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: for We did vouchsafe them Our messages, but they obstinately turned their backs upon them-
ayahs.arabicText: وَآتَيْنَاهُمْ آيَاتِنَا فَكَانُوا عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ

ayahs.englishText: notwithstanding that they had been wont [to enjoy Our blessings and] to hew out dwellings from the mountains, [wherein they could live] in security
ayahs.arabicText: وَكَانُوا يَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ الْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا آمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and so the blast [of Our punishment] overtook them at early morn,
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّيْحَةُ مُصْبِحِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and of no avail to them was all [the power] that they had acquired.
ayahs.arabicText: فَمَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُمْ مَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ

ayahs.englishText: AND [remember:] We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them without [an inner] truth; but, behold, the Hour [when this will become clear to all] is indeed yet to come. Hence, forgive [men's failings] with fair forbearance:
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ ۗ وَإِنَّ السَّاعَةَ لَآتِيَةٌ ۖ فَاصْفَحِ الصَّفْحَ الْجَمِيلَ

ayahs.englishText: verily, thy Sustainer is the all-knowing Creator of all things!
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ الْخَلَّاقُ الْعَلِيمُ

ayahs.englishText: AND, INDEED, We have bestowed upon thee seven of the oft repeated [verses], and [have, thus, laid open before thee] this sublime Qur'an:
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَاكَ سَبْعًا مِنَ الْمَثَانِي وَالْقُرْآنَ الْعَظِيمَ

ayahs.englishText: [so] turn, not thine eyes [longingly] towards the worldly benefits which We have granted unto some of those [that deny the truth]. And neither grieve over those [who refuse to heed thee], but spread the wings of thy tenderness over the believers,
ayahs.arabicText: لَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِ أَزْوَاجًا مِنْهُمْ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and say: "Behold, I am indeed the plain warner [promised by God]!
ayahs.arabicText: وَقُلْ إِنِّي أَنَا النَّذِيرُ الْمُبِينُ

ayahs.englishText: [For, thou art the bearer of a divine writ] such as We have bestowed from on high upon those who [afterwards] broke it up into parts,
ayahs.arabicText: كَمَا أَنْزَلْنَا عَلَى الْمُقْتَسِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [and] who [now] declare this Qur'an to be [a tissue of] falsehoods!
ayahs.arabicText: الَّذِينَ جَعَلُوا الْقُرْآنَ عِضِينَ

ayahs.englishText: But, by thy Sustainer! [On the Day of Judgment] We shall indeed call them to account, one and all,
ayahs.arabicText: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَسْأَلَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

ayahs.englishText: for whatever they have done!
ayahs.arabicText: عَمَّا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Hence, proclaim openly all that thou hast been bidden [to say], and leave alone all those who ascribe divinity to aught beside God:
ayahs.arabicText: فَاصْدَعْ بِمَا تُؤْمَرُ وَأَعْرِضْ عَنِ الْمُشْرِكِينَ

ayahs.englishText: verily, We shall suffice thee against all who [now] deride [this message - all]
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا كَفَيْنَاكَ الْمُسْتَهْزِئِينَ

ayahs.englishText: who assert that there are, side by side with God, other divine powers as well: for in time they will come to know [the truth].
ayahs.arabicText: الَّذِينَ يَجْعَلُونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ ۚ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And well do We know that thy bosom is constricted by the [blasphemous] things that they say:
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ نَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ يَضِيقُ صَدْرُكَ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ

ayahs.englishText: but extol thou thy Sustainer's limitless glory and praise Him, and be of those who prostrate themselves [before Him] in adoration,
ayahs.arabicText: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَكُنْ مِنَ السَّاجِدِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and worship thy Sustainer till death comes to thee.
ayahs.arabicText: وَاعْبُدْ رَبَّكَ حَتَّىٰ يَأْتِيَكَ الْيَقِينُ
